thisisemad 159594990213 "2017-04-15 08:01:57 GMT" https://thisisemad.tumblr.com/post/159594990213/soulmates "khadlja: rasulullah (saw) mentioned in a hadith that those souls who knew each other in the realm of souls [alim e arwah] would find and know each other in this world too
column2: and those who developed animosity in that realm would dislike each other here as well.  and that’s why
column4: you’re suddenly overcome with a feeling that you know them from somewhere or that you’ve met them before. and maybe this also accounts for those moments when your heart misses someone you’ve never met
column5: because your soul is yearning for those other souls and waiting for them to show up in your life here in this world. isn’t that beautiful
column6: subhan Allah?  Always reblog." False text

column1: thisisemad 149385084178 "2016-08-23 21:49:37 GMT" https://thisisemad.tumblr.com/post/149385084178/can-you-grow-into-loving-someone "arabarabarab:  I remember when i was 15. It was the night before Iman’s wedding. We were sitting on the rooftop of our building
column3: Iman and Rihab. We were just sitting on the rooftop
column4: talking and watching the lights of the city. Suddenly Iman to cry hysterically. She said to us than the worst thing you can do is to marry someone you don’t love. I will never forget what she said and the way she said it. The whole week before the wedding Iman had just slept. She woke up a few times a day to eat then went to sleep again. I just thought that she was sick and i didn’t understand that she take the sleeping pills to escape the reality in her dreams. The truth was that Iman in fact was really much in love
column5: but not with the person she was marrying. She was in love with Zied. They were young and in love. Zied had promised many times to come and talk to Iman’s dad about their future
column6: but something always seemed to get in the way. Iman’s mother didn’t like Zied. She thought he was still a kid
column7: with no money or a proper job to provide for her daughter. She said to Iman that a handsome young man like Zied would never marry someone like her
column8: she wasn’t even that pretty and her skin wasn’t pale enough. So Iman heartbrokenly left Zied. Then a someone came to ask for Iman’s hand. He was a bit older man with a good stable job and he promised her better living conditions
column9: a big wedding and a happy future. Under the pressure of her mother
column10: Iman said yes. Didn’t take long for her to realize that she had made a big mistake. She tried to tell her mom that she had changed her mind but the mother refused to listen. She didn’t answer the guys calls and he’d come to their house furious of her behavior. Iman was too scared to stay strong so she just accepted her destiny. She thought she had no other choice. So now
column11: 6 years after she has two kids and they are living a quite stable life. Things could be worse
column12: she says. When asking her does she love her husband she answered that she has learned to love him. They share a house
column13: car and two wonderful kids.  She also tells me that she happened to see Zied the other they when she was taking her kids to school. Her hands started sweating and heart racing. She couldn’t stop the tears from falling down on her face.  I don’t understand this “learning” to love someone *after* you’ve made the commitment to marry? Sure
column14: it takes time to get to know someone anyway. But to say you’ve “learnt” is exactly that: you’ve studied up over time as if it’s a school test the different ways to make someone happy and avoid ticking them off.Sigh. This is such a weird concept of marriage we need to get rid of." False text

column1: thisisemad 146475632013 "2016-06-25 23:56:21 GMT" https://thisisemad.tumblr.com/post/146475632013/my-sister-took-her-kids-to-the-polling-station-on "My sister took her kids to the polling station on Thursday. On Friday afternoon
column2: my three-year-old niece asked if I had gone “for the vote” as well. I said I went in the morning. She then asked
column3: “what happened?” I hope she doesn’t end up having to learn about how damn good (overall) the European Union was for Britain from a textbook in high school. Sigh. She then gave a running commentary of her brother playing Goat Simulator on my phone." True text
